metadata.name: Modify Group Policy Settings - ScriptBlockLogging
metadata.comment: Detect malicious GPO modifications can be used to implement many other malicious behaviors.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM script_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('\\\\software\\\\policies\\\\microsoft\\\\windows\\\\system')) AND (contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('grouppolicyrefreshtimedc')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('grouppolicyrefreshtimeoffsetdc')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('grouppolicyrefreshtime')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('grouppolicyrefreshtimeoffset')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('enablesmartscreen')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('shellsmartscreenlevel'))))

output.summary: Detect malicious GPO modifications can be used to implement many other malicious behaviors.
